name: Never use PS and VP1 login to develop - Sub Page (PeopleSoft)
associatedValueName: Name of the Development Login used for the last update
description: Identify each object that has been modified with the login PS or VP1
output:
This report lists all the Sub Pages last updated with PS or VP1 login.
It provides the following information: 
- Sub Page full name.
- The associated value is the name of the Development Login.
rationale:
The delivered PeopleSoft logins, such as PS, VP1, should not be used to develop. Using these default logins defeats the purpose of tracing and thus it disables to possibility to identify the real committer.
Any violation to this principle disable the possibility to precisely identify the author of unwanted code or eventually of malicous code.
reference: Securing Your PeopleSoft Application Environment (PeopleSoft Red Paper Series)
remediation: A specific login has to be created and used to identify precisely who has modified the object.
alternativeName: Never use PS and VP1 login to develop - Sub Page (PeopleSoft)

qualityStandards.name: Remove development, test and/or custom application accounts, user IDs, and passwords before applications become active or are released to customers.
Remove development, test and/or custom application accounts, user IDs, and passwords before applications become active or are released to customers.
Unnecessary built-in application accounts must be disabled.
